turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I would like to change your name.

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: To what?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: You're now Mantan.

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: Mantan?  I don't even care as long as I'm dancing.  Which reminds me, I need some new kicks.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I want you to start using the name Mantan and not Manray if you don't mind.

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: You have to start getting into your character.

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: Mantan?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Mantan!!

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: I'm not playin' myself no mo'.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: How you sound?

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: I won't do it anymore.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Manray, I'm very sorry about ya boy Cheeba and Sloan.  Believe me, it gave me no joy pulling ya coattail about her, just lookin' out for a brother.  I feel you, all this stuff happenin' at once but you can't let if affect your work.  You gotta be professional.

turns.speaker: MANRAY
turns.text: I'm always gonna be that.  But I ain't doing no more buck dancing.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: No costume.  No blackface.

turns.speaker: GARY BYRD
turns.text: Our guest today is Pierre Delacroix. He is the creator of the highly controversial TV show MANTAN. Let's get right into it.  You have been called by some in the community a traitor, a sellout, an Uncle Tom. Why does your show generate such feelings?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Because race has always been a sensitive issue in this country. Gary, I have no problem with people disagreeing with the show, it's when folks start trying to mess with my inherent right as an artist, that's when I get mad.  No one, in any way, shape or form should be censored.

turns.speaker: GARY BYRD
turns.text: No matter how sexist or racist the material may be?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Yes.  And I say yes because who is to judge?  Who is to stand before us and say this is righteous and this is not?  Who?  Who can play God?

turns.speaker: GARY BYRD
turns.text: But the line has to be drawn.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Don't you people get it?  We're in the 21st Century.  Slavery was over four hundred years ago.  All that stuff people talked in the old days, it's over.  Folks always crying, white man this, white man that.  Let's all grow up.

turns.speaker: GARY BYRD
turns.text: Are you trying to excuse our Holocaust?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Can I finish?  Thank you.  I had a great Aunt, we called her Sister. She went to her grave not believing man had walked on the Moon.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: ...exactly thirty-two minutes ago.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: I'm sorry I'm late.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: Do you know how much information can be dispensed in one minute alone?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I didn't find out about this very important staff meeting until...

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Four minutes ago.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: So are you telling me everyone knew about this get-together except you?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I wasn't told about this until Marie informed me as soon as I got off the elevator.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: Do you know what C.P. Time is?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: C.P. Time is Colored People's Time. The stereotypical belief that Negroes are always late.  That Negroes have no sense of time - time except when it comes to music or dance.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: I'm sorry about my blowup but I have to have a whipping boy every meeting.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I understand.  But again, in all honesty I was not informed.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: Forget it.  I believe you're my most creative person I've got on staff.  You're hip.  You know what's happening.  I got some corny white boys and girls writing for me.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: I understand Black culture.  I grew up around black people all my life. If the truth be told I probably know "niggers" better than you, Monsieur Delacroix.  Please don't get offended by my use of the quote-unquote N word.  I got a black wife and three bi-racial children, so I feel I have a right to use that word.  I don't give a damn what Spike says, Tarantino is right.  Nigger is just a word.  If Dirty Ole Bastard can use it every other word so can I.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I would prefer you not use that word in my presence.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: NIGGER.  NIGGER.  NIGGER.  NIGGER.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: The material you've been creating is too white bread.  White people with black faces.  The Huxtable's, Cosby, revolutionary.  But that's dead.  We can't go down that road again.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I don't agree.  The Negro middle class does exist, and it's rich material for a dramatic series or sitcom.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: I'm telling you it's not.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: The middle class black family moves into a white suburban enclave.  The middle class black family moves into a small Southern town that is run by the KKK.  The middle class single black father raises his teenage daughter.  The middle class single black father raises his teenage daughter.  The middle class single black mother raises her teenage son.  And so on and so forth.  It's too clean, too antiseptic...

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: ...to white?  I still feel all of my scripts would make good shows.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: Delacroix, wake up, brother man. The reason why they didn't get picked up was because nobody - and I mean NOBODY - niggers and crackers alike wants to see that junk.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I've never been given a fair shot.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: You got your head stuck up your ass with your Harvard education and your pretentious ways.  Brother man, I'm blacker than you.  I'm keepin' it real and you're frontin', trying to be white.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I'm an oreo, a sell out?  Because I don't aspire to do HOMEBOYS FROM OUT OF SPACE, SECRET DIARY OF DESMOND PFEIFFER, A PJ's or some as you might put it, some "nigger" show?  I'm a Tom?  I'm whiter than white and you're blacker than black? Is that what you think?

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: That's exactly what I think.  I want you to create something that people want to see.  Let's be honest, the majority of the people in the country are deaf, dumb and blind and I'm including 35 million African-Americans.  You know and I know "niggers" set the trend, set the styles.  This is a golden opportunity now.  These idiots have to be led to the water.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I'm not sure if I can deliver what you want.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: You will or you'll be back at BET so quick you'll never know what hit you.  I need a mid-season replacement and pronto.  It will be on the fast track.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: What is it you want from me?  Some plantation follies?  Some sitcom that takes place on a watermelon patch?  Some show that follows four nigger generations of junkies and crackheads?  You want me to go back to the ante bellum days?

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: Yes!  Yes!  Yes!  I want a show that will make headlines, that will have millions and millions of households tuned in, glued to their televisions every week.  I want advertisers dying to buy on this show.  I'm gonna squeeze this show out of you if it kills you.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: Delacroix, I'm glad you got your mind right.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: It's right and tight.  Good morning, let me introduce you to everybody. You know my assistant, Sloan.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: We're all happy to be here and I'm going to paint a picture for you.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: I'm wid it.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I've done a lot of soul searching and once again you are right.  In my previous work it's been all surface, superficial.  I have never really dug deep.  Not anymore.  As Mark Twain fully understood satire is the way.  Race has always been a hot button in this country's history and it needs to be pushed harder.  If we are ever to live side by side in peace and harmony. It's about promoting racial healing.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: Go on.  Good so far.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I know you're familiar with minstrel shows.  They came about at the turn of the 19th century.  It was a variety show in which the talent was in blackface - singing, dancing, telling jokes, doing skits. Dunwitty, I ask you when was the last time there was a good variety show on the air.  Carol Burnett? HeeHaw?

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: Word!!!

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: So let's take this great form, this very American tradition of entertainment into the 21st century, into the new millennium.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: The name of the show?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: It is called: MANTAN - THE NEW MILLENNIUM MINSTREL SHOW.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: I'm lovin' it.  You know how I know? Because I'm getting a boner, my Johnson is hard, no disrespect my sister.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: I'm feelin' dis'!

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: It will take a lot of courage and backbone on the part of the CNS to get this on the air.  In fact, I would understand fully if the subject matter is deemed too risque, too controversial.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: Don't worry about that, that's my department.  Now who do we cast? We need a star.  Can Whoopi sing or dance?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I don't know if Whoopi is the way to go.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: Are these our two stars, sitting here in front of my nose?  Which one is Mantan again?

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: That's a great handle.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Mantan and Sleep 'n Eat.  Two real coons.  I know we're way out there but it's satire.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: I want you take it there.  All the way to the edge and back.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Every week we follow the trials and tribulations of two real coons - Mantan and Sleep 'n Eat.  The Dusky Duo.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: What are there character traits?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Ignorant, dullwitted, lazy, and unlucky.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: Exactly!

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Mantan is an uneducated Negro who always by some stroke of unbelievable stupidity makes his best laid plans go haywire.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: And Sleep 'n Eat is his comical sidekick?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Yep, you guessed it.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: This could be bigger than "Amos and Andy."

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Protest finally forced "Amos and Andy" off the air.  Could stop us from ever getting on.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: Let'em try.  I will kill to make this happen.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Negroes would be in an uproar.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: So what.  We would just give the NAACP a donation that would be the end of that.  No such thing as bad publicity.  So what.  Earlier you said singing and dancing.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Mantan right here is a gifted hoofer.  He has educated feet.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: Who are the other characters?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Do we have characters?  How about Honeycutt, Snowflake, Rastus, Nigger, Jim, Sambo, Jungle Bunny, and how could we forget Aunt Jemima.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: We gonna hit 'em wid da BOMB DICKEY on dis' one.  What's the setting?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: In the projects.  Like Eddie Murphy's "The PJ's."

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: Ya first bad move.  Projects been done.  That's one of the problems now, everything, movies, TV, are set in the urban jungle, da hood. That's so tired.  Mantan's Millennium Minstrel Show should be set on a plantation.  In Alabama.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: And every week these Alabama porch monkeys will make us cry, make us laugh, make us look at our own humanity.  Make us feel good to be alive.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I don't know about that plantation angle.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: What are you talkin' 'bout?  It's the move.  Stay wid me now.  We're movin' fast.  What does everybody else think about this?

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: That'swhatI'mtalkin''bout. That'swhatI'mtalkin''bout!  He's off the hiz-hook!

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: We think so.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: Sleep 'n Eat, what do you do?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I strongly feel that a Negro should direct this.  This kind of satire is a high wire act in a gale storm. One misstep and we're doing "Amos and Andy."  Only a Negro will have the sensitivity and cultural awareness to navigate this dangerous terrain.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: To hire someone solely on their ethnicity, gender or religion is not right.  It's un-American.  I will hire someone who is most qualified for this particular job.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I was hoping to perhaps direct some episodes myself, if not the pilot soon after.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: I want a hot, young white director. Maybe the kid, that pheenom who just did that hot new sexy Madonna video.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: You're telling me some white boy is gonna direct this pilot?

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: I just want you to meet him.  Keep an open mind.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Besides, what does he know about Negroes?

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: Probably nuthin', but that's why it's such a sexy way to go. Sometimes an outsider has a fresh new outlook, a different unique perspective.  A black director, y'know what he's gonna do given the subject matter?  With this kid, the possibilities are endless.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: What are his qualifications besides being a white male and directing a hot new sexy freaky Madonna video?

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: If Spielburg can direct "The Color Purple" and "Amistad", our whiz kid can direct the Mantan pilot.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: That's exactly my point.  Has he even directed actors before in anything?

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: No!!!  Just meet the guy.  That's all I'm asking.  Look, I'll even let you choose your own musical director.  You can have that.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: In the immortal words of Derrick Coleman, WHOOOPDEEDAMNDOO!!!

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: Derrick Coleman, he possessed all the talent in the world, coulda, shoulda, been a great ballplayer but alas D.C. didn't want it bad enough.  Delacroix, do you want it? Bad enough to kill for it?  Do you want it that much.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: I'm gonna leave you two creative geniuses alone.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Dunwitty, don't leave.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I will not be held responsible for these revisions.  These changes are not the way I want to go.  This is an outrage.  This is a sham.  A violation!

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: Calm down, please.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I don't give a good goddamn about Finland, Norway, Sweden or wherever ya blond ass came from.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: We just punched it up a bit.  Made it funnier.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Funnier to who and at who's expense? Dunwitty, when Negroes start to run amok, the boycotts, when the demostrations commence, I'm giving them your home address.  Let's see how you like it when they picket your lawn in Greenwich, Connecticut.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: I seriously doubt that will ever happen.  Didn't I tell you I know your people better than you do. But if by some miracle you're correct, I'm gonna invite them inside my house and we'll have a sit down, discuss it like civil human beings.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: Yo, DeLa, I just got the news from the CNS brass.  They saw some clips from the pilot and they're rushing it onto the air.  Yo, we're a midseason replacement, ordered 12 shows.  We're on in 3 weeks.  Didya hear what I just said, Yo?

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: They didn't even view a rough cut, just some scenes we quickly cut together.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: This has to be a big mistake.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: The big mistake was my not believing in your genius earlier.  From the gitgo, from jump street.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Hold on a sec, I got a call.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Hello, Mommy, let me get rid of this other call.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I gots to go, it's my Moms.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: I want to meet her one day, please tell her the great news.  I'm OUT like Vanilla Ice.

turns.speaker: JUNEBUG
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I want to speak with you.

turns.speaker: JUNEBUG
turns.text: Go away, unless you got my money.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: It's me, Peerless.

turns.speaker: JUNEBUG
turns.text: Son.  Good to seeya.  Good to seeya.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: It's been a long time.

turns.speaker: JUNEBUG
turns.text: Pull up a chair.  Oh, excuse me, this is my lady DOT.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Pleased to meet you.

turns.speaker: JUNEBUG
turns.text: Good woman.  I trained her right.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Daddy, she's younger than me.

turns.speaker: JUNEBUG
turns.text: My game is still strong.  No Viagra for me, don't need no chemicals. Just my tonic.

turns.speaker: JUNEBUG
turns.text: Purely for medicinal purposes.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I thought you had promised Mommy you stopped.

turns.speaker: JUNEBUG
turns.text: I did.  I'm not an alcoholic.  I just like to drink.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: How did you end up here?

turns.speaker: JUNEBUG
turns.text: How did I end up at the third rate chittlin' circuit greasy hole in the wall in West Hell, Virginny? Is that what you're asking ya Daddy?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: That's what I'm askin'.

turns.speaker: JUNEBUG
turns.text: Because I had too much pride.  Too much integrity.  I wouldn't lick nobody's butt.  Some material I refused to do.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Daddy, it can't be just because of that.  There had to be other factors.

turns.speaker: JUNEBUG
turns.text: That's the only reason, period. They only want one certain kind of black comic.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Another one of your conspiracies to hold ya career back?

turns.speaker: JUNEBUG
turns.text: All I know is what happened to me. All that other mess I just file into the "life's too short" category.

turns.speaker: JUNEBUG
turns.text: Enough about me, what's happening with you?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: The same old, same old.  Trying to get my stuff through.

turns.speaker: JUNEBUG
turns.text: Dem white boys giving you a hard time?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Nuthin' I can't handle.

turns.speaker: JUNEBUG
turns.text: The truth is never let them seeya sweat.  You do that, that's half the battle.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Where do you go from here?

turns.speaker: JUNEBUG
turns.text: Three nights Charleston, South Carolina.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I didn't mean that, in life.

turns.speaker: JUNEBUG
turns.text: In life?  I'ma keep on living, having a good drink, got me a good young woman, make a couple of dollars and make people laugh. Haven't I always tol' you all nigga's are entertainers?  The question is what are you gonna do, Peerless?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Let's get him over to the bed.

turns.speaker: JUNEBUG
turns.text: Baby, you treat me so good. Peerless, you're a good son, I love you.  You never gave me no trouble.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I love you too, Daddy.

turns.speaker: JUNEBUG
turns.text: Always keep 'em laughing.

turns.speaker: DOT
turns.text: Glad to meet you, too.  You are all your father talks about.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Is that so?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: How long has my father been like this?

turns.speaker: DOT
turns.text: Not that often.  He was excited to see you.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: So he drank himself into a stuper?

turns.speaker: DOT
turns.text: The drinking is for the pain.  It doesn't kill it, just dulls it.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: So what's up with you?

turns.speaker: DOT
turns.text: I was a hostess at this club, your Daddy was performing and I had never laughed so hard in my life. He asked me to come with him.  I quit my job and we've been together ever since.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Don't tell him it's from me or he won't take it.

turns.speaker: DOT
turns.text: Your father is proud of you.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: He never showed it.

turns.speaker: DOT
turns.text: He did the best way he knew how, Junebug is stubborn just like you.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: How was it?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me about this staff meeting?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Nobody told me anything.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: What good are you if you don't tell me stuff like this?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: It wasn't my fault.  If I would have known, I would have known.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Manray!

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Manray!

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: How did you know?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: It hit me like a ton of bricks.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: How can this be?  You and me at the same time, the exact same thought. It's scary.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: The idea was out there in the universe.  Now what?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Manray was under our nose the whole time.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Do you know how you will use him?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Not yet, but this thing will never get made.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: You lost me.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Dunwitty wants a Coon show.  And that's what I'm going to give him, it's going to be so racist, so negative, he won't have the balls to put it on the air.  Hence I'll prove my point.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: What point is that?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: The point being that him, the networks don't want Black people on television unless they are buffoons.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Sounds risky to me.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: You getting cold feet?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: I'm in till the end.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Good.  I'm going to need your support.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Can't you just quit?  Walk away?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: And lose out on my money?  The only way I get paid is if I get fired. And that's what I intend to do.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Maybe something happened to them. Maybe they're lying in an alley bleed to death.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Manray better not be bleeding to death.  I need him.  After we're done he can do whatever he wants to do, until then, he's ours.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: This is Cheeba.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I feel like somebody hit me upside da head with a sledgehammer.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: What is your problem?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: My problem is MANTAN THE NEW MILLENIUM MINSTREL SHOW.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Why did you even come up with that shit if you didn't want it made?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: It was the principle.  Dunwitty had to be enlightened.  I was making a point.  I take pride in my work. Plus, I already told you I wasn't gonna walk away from my money.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Fuck da money.  Why do through all this effort?  Why?  Are you looking for love from Dunwitty?  For respect?  Dunwitty and his likes don't give a goddamn about you.  So now what are you gonna do?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Even if money wasn't an issue, Dunwitty will still go ahead without me and that could be more dangerous.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: What's the chances of MANTAN being picked up?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I wouldn't bet against it.  My Negroidal ass is stuck between the proverbial rock and a hard place.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Like I said, all this for some twisted, distorted sense of principal.  Dunwitty, he just tolerates your Negroidal ass, he doesn't respect it.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Good morning, for those of you who don't know me, I'm Pierre Delacroix. I'm running things and this here is my assistant Sloan Hopkins.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I've never worked with any of you and you've never worked with me so we'll be starting from scratch. I'm a fair person, a straight shooter and I don't hold my tongue. Everybody up in here should know I had nothing to do with you being hired.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: This is the group I was telling you about.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Which one is your brother?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: The big one.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: You've said that already.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I'm gonna slit my wrists.  Cut my throat.  For the love of Joseph.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Just want to say good luck.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Break a leg.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Your life will never be the same.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Let's leave the man in peace so he can get ready.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: We both lied to him.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: What do you want me to say?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Just don't lie to me.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Same here.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: The pleasure is mine.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: I want to apologize about my brother and the Mau-Mau's.  I should not have imposed them on you.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: C'mon.  You were only doing what family is supposed to be doing for family.  You gave your brother a shot.  That's all anybody can ask for, an opportunity, a chance, a shot.  He got his.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Who's side are you on?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: I'm sorry, I can't help it.  It's too funny.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: What would their reaction be?  I hadn't the foggiest.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Everybody shut up.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: So you have your small victory, now what?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: A small victory isn't that small when you've been use to losing.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: What is this?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: A gift.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: No matter what you think, you did come up with something unique. Open it.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: The Jolly Nigger Bank.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: This is authentic, not a repro, circa turn of the century.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: I thought it was appropiate.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Is that good or bad?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: It's all good.  You got a hit show, you're gonna need a bank.  Plus, I love these old black collectibles.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: How so?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: To me, it shows part of our history in this country, a time when we were considered inferior, sub-human.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Why'd you do that?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: I don't want to hear it.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: How long have you and Hambone been hangin' out?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: You're the one that put us together. We're friends.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: That crazy brother of yours doesn't think so.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: He's just playing big brother.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Oh, is he?  You getting jiggy with Mantan?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Please don't go there.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Dunwitty and I feel you've been getting too close to him, getting his mind all messed up.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: I can't lie to him.  If he asks me something, I tell him what I think.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Do you have to be so damn forthright?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: DeLa, you should try it sometime. Come into the light.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Light?

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: That which has been hidden in darkness is now in the light.  This bucket of blood.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: You can talk all that mumbo jumbo if you want to but your hands are much bloody.  I know where I made my big mistake.  I have a general rule, never get involved romantically with somebody crazier than you.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: This is crazy.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: That's why it will be so much fun.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: That was a mistake, but I don't regret it.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: The first and only time.  A big mistake.  I'm gonna have to ask you not to see Mantan anymore.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Work related or otherwise?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Otherwise.  I trust you know the difference.  You're an intelligent woman, finished at NYU.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: DeLa, kiss my big black ass.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: And that's how you got me in the first place.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: Don't make me have to use this.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I didn't think this was in your studies at NYU.

turns.speaker: SLOAN
turns.text: I told you but you wouldn't listen. You never listened to me.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Give me the gun.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Yes, your name?

turns.speaker: MONA
turns.text: He, I'm Mona.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Hi, Mona.

turns.speaker: MONA
turns.text: I perfectly understand where you're coming from.  As a minority I can relate to your struggle also.  But I think you should give us all a chance.  We want this pilot to be successful just as much as you. Please don't be so quick to judge us based only on our whiteness.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Oh, is that what I'm doing?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: This thing was rigged, the deck was stacked, the fix was in.  Could Don King be near?  Good thing Sloan had my back.  She's my rock.  This was going to be a whole lot of work.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: David, I appreciate your comments. Anybody got an ideas?  Everybody just talk out loud.

turns.speaker: MONA
turns.text: I've always liked the format of Rowan and Martin's "LAUGH-IN."

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I'm happy for all of us.  It's just we have a great responsibility now. The pressure is on.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: Pressure?  DeLa, you don't know what the hell real pressure is. SHEEETT!!!  This is lightstuff. Now when you scramblin' out on the street in da January winter and the hawk is talkin' to you with NO money and NO prospects of money anytime soon, now that there is some pressure.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I didn't mean it to sound like that.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: That's the way it came out.  Let me ask you one question.  Have you ever been in want, in need your entire privileged life?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Now I'm privileged?!  Why?  Because I didn't grow up on food stamps and welfare?  Because I didn't call home a cardboard box?  No, I never ever went to bed hungry and I'm proud of it, too.  Whoever told you that living in poverty earns you somekind of badge of honor flat out lied to you.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: The point I'm trying to make is that this is a blessing.  It's going to be fun doing this show and we should all look at it that way.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Can I kiss you too?

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: Naw.  I'll take the zero.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: You feel good, not nervous?

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: I feel fine.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Not nervous?  Relaxed?

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: Sloan, will you take your boss out of here so I can get ready.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: So they can be on TV.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: You sound like the media.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: This is nothing.  It will blow over by tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: Same thing Giuliani said.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Tomorrow it will be all about cruelty to animals or some sex scandal.  Besides, there is no such thing as bad publicity.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: No joke.  Serious.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: Hope the same thing doesn't happen to me.  That's some big shoes to fill.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: In time.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: What are you?  A man or a mouse? Are you a punk?  Punking out on me?

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: You getting scared because some people don't like what you are doing?

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: Yo, DeLa, they tried to lynch my black ass up in dat piece.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: You've made it from the guttermost to the uppermost.  Don't you know you should never let them see you sweat.  Y'knowwhatI'msayin'?

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: And now is definitely not the time to bitch up.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: You shouldn't even be mad at me over Sloan.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: What you did is dead wrong.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Oh, is it?  Buddy boy, in this business if people don't produce, they get fired.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: Sloan is the hardest working person I've ever met.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Let me ask you a question, if I may. How do you think she got the job in the first place?  I don't mean to burst your bubble, Mantan the Marvelous, but Sloan is an opportunity.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: I don't believe it.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Do I have to spell it out for you? In fact, go ask Sloan yourself.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Mantan, we got a show to tape.

turns.speaker: MANTAN
turns.text: My name is Manray, goddamnit.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Kook and the Gang, it's Manray. Let's do the taping.  You go back to your dressing room, get dressed and blacken up.

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: You must think I'm some kind of fool.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: It looks delicious.

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: You hear me talkin' to you.  The only time you come up here when something is wrong.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: C'mon, Mommy, don't start with that I'm an ungrateful son stuff.

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: I said no such thing.  All I said is that something must be wrong.

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: How's the food?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Can't beat it with a hammer.  Well, since you asked, it looks like I may have a new show, a pilot being shot.

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: That's wonderful.  Isn't that what you always wanted, a show of your own?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: It was.  It is.  But this is a different kind of show.

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: If at first it's not what you want, just work that much harder, Peerless.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Mommy, please don't call me that.

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: Son, Peerless is your name.  Now you might be one of these Hollywood types, change your name and all that but Peerless Dothan is on your birth certificate.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I know what's on my birth certificate.  You heard from Daddy?

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: I guess he's still on the road. What kind of show is this?  Are they some Negroes in it without being buffoons?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: To answer your question, there are a lot of Negroes in it and what is your definition of buffoons?

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: Peerless, I didn't raise a buffoon. We have enough of those on television already.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Please let me know when you hear from Daddy, get a number or something.

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: I will.  And good luck with your show.  I hope it's a huge success. You've worked very hard.  You deserve it.

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: Peerless, your father called.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I'll be right over.

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: He wants you to come and see him.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: He said that?

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: Yes he did.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Where is he?

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: He's performing at some place outside of Richmond, Virginia.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I can't go all the way down south.

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: Richmond is not all the way down south.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: I don't even know why you're still concerned over him.  Daddy's not with you.

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: Regardless, he still is your father.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: It's gonna be hard for me to get away with the show taking off.

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: Even more reason to see him.  He'll be overjoyed with your success.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: C'mon, Mommy.  Daddy hasn't been impressed with anything I've ever done.  From winning my fifth grade Spelling Bee to the present.

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: Peerless, last time, go see your father.

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: I'm doing okay.  Been reading about your show, it's all over everywhere. I watched it's all over everywhere. I watched it once.  I thought you said there would be no buffoonery.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: You going to attack me too.  The show is a hit.  Aren't you happy for me?

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: Of course I'm happy for you. You've worked very hard for your success.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Yes I have, very hard.  Has Daddy called?

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Not at all?

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: You know how your Daddy is.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: If and when he calls, please don't forget to ask him if he's seen Mantan.

turns.speaker: ORCHID
turns.text: I won't forget.  When are you coming up here to see your mother?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Soon.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Nice to meet you.  If you don't mind me asking you - how old are you?

turns.speaker: JUKKA
turns.text: I just turned twenty.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Where are you from?

turns.speaker: JUKKA
turns.text: Helsinki, which is the capital of Finland.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Finland.

turns.speaker: JUKKA
turns.text: You know, Finlandia vodka?  Yes?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Yes, I know.  Jukka, have you ever seen a Negro person before?  Even had a real conversation with a real Negro before?

turns.speaker: JUKKA
turns.text: What's a Negro.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: A fiasco.  A disaster.  A boondoggle. An abomination.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Did you just ask me what's a Negro? I'M A NEGRO!!!

turns.speaker: JUKKA
turns.text: Ahhh!!!  I never heard of that term before.  I thought you were BLACK of African-American.  No?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Well before there was BLACK or AFRICAN AMERICAN, there were NEGROES.  I'M A NEGRO.

turns.speaker: JUKKA
turns.text: Thank you for correcting my ignorance.  I'm looking forward to working side by side with you.  I feel we make a good team.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: How did you get this gig?

turns.speaker: JUKKA
turns.text: My visual style is very erotic, sexy, how do you say - hot?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: This is a TV show, not a music video.

turns.speaker: JUKKA
turns.text: Then will you teach me what I need to know.  Maybe we learn from each other, if that's possible, no?

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: This is a travesty.  A debacle.

turns.speaker: DELACROIX
turns.text: Good luck, Jukka.  Do a good show.

turns.speaker: JUKKA
turns.text: Thank you very much.  I always try my best.

turns.speaker: DUNWITTY
turns.text: I know all of you have seen the overnight ratings.  Through the roof.  But in this game you gotta be one, two, three steps ahead.  I introduce you to Myrna Goldfarb. She's the best media consultant in the biz.

turns.speaker: MYRNA
turns.text: First, I would like to say I love the show.  It's very courageous. My parents marched in Selma, Alabama with Dr. King.
